Comment 10: 
The current spec permits this already - the 2nd comment was based on the old (non-tip)
spec. From: http://tip.golang.org/ref/spec#Index_expressions :

"- a constant index must be non-negative and representable by a value of type int"

This clearly permits untyped integer values, say 1.0, as indices.

Changing this into a gc compiler bug.
